name: Peppermill Resort Spa Casino

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Peppermill in Reno many times but this last trip may have been our Best Ever! The entertainment and hospitality was truly "over the top"! Don't know if it was due to the fact that it was the weekend after Thanksgiving or what but everything was PERFECT!! We stayed in the Tuscany Tower Suites which I would highly recommend. The little bit extra for the room but it is worth it! I have to figure out a way to make this a monthly adventure! Love Reno and love the Peppermill!! GQ2
reviews.title: Can't Miss with the Peppermill in Reno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at several hotel/casinos in and around Reno during the past several years. With very few exceptions, our experience has been generally good. However, our experience at the Peppermill has always been exceptionally good. Everyone we have delt with from hotel check in, valet, housekeeping, restaurant staff, bar tenders, slot people, etc., etc., have been very helpful and pleasant. Our room accomodations have always been exceptionally nice. To anyone looking for a clean, comfortable and friendly place to stay in the Reno area, we would not hesitate to recommend staying at the Peppermill.
reviews.title: All Around First Class Facility

reviews.text: I was worried when I read some of the reviews, but had already booked so I decided to take the chance. I'm glad I did. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The decor was nice, like you'de see in Vegas. The only reason I have rated it a four was because my daughter and I had to walk out of the hotel into the back to get to the west tower. It was late and a little uncomfortable. Other than that, everything was perfect! Will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds

reviews.text: We frequently stay at the Peppermill when visiting family in Reno. We stay in the Tuscan tower which has beautiful accommodations; very clean and comfortable. There are great restaurants in the complex, our favorite being Romanza Ristornate Italiano - bellissimo. The service in this hotel is fabulous and the automated valet parking retrieval system is very quick. I would highly recommend a stay at the Peppermill.
reviews.title: Peppermill-Great Accommodations, Great Food, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to the Peppermill Hotel and Casino. We were extremely impressed with the ambiance. The staff was first rate. The service was first class and our suite was extraordinary. We would definitely make a return visit.
reviews.title: First class hotel and casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recently at the Tuscan Tower in Reno, Peppermill Hotel. It was well presented, quality, and with excellent views. The convention Center was Tops, flavorful food, great service, spacious. The restaurants were also excellent. Wonderful stay. Don't forget the Truckee River walk when in town, Just go S. on Virgina past Court House, safe lovely stroll, even saw a fly fisherman, and two Kyakers! Also the Auto Musuem Top Quality!
reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Value

reviews.text: We stayed at the Peppermill in the new Tuscan Tower and it was very clean, comfortable and had amazing views of the Sierra mountains. I am originally from Reno and was there with my boyfriend visiting family and we will definitely stay there next time! The room rates were great and the restaurants were lovely. It was also a benefit that it didn't smell like cigarettes at all on the property!!
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Reno!

reviews.text: The tower is a great addition to the Biggest Little City in the World.
reviews.title: Great Holiday Family Getaway

reviews.text: The amenities were fantastic! The spa and massage were very relaxing. I would highly recommend this place for a girl's weekend! Or, a family reunion or just a couple's getaway! The food choices were plenty and delicious.
reviews.title: Peppermill Exceeds Expectations!
Best hotel resort in Reno
reviews.text: I travelled to Reno solo to visit friends and family and spent the week at Peppermill. The Tuscany Tower room I had was impeccably decorated and ultra clean. Being on my own I was most concerned with security and felt very safe while anywhere on premesis no matter what the time. The sushi prepared at Peppermill's Oceans restaurant was fantastic! From the time I checked in to the time I left, the employees I met were highly professional, very friendly and helpful.

Peppermill Resort and Casino is the only place to stay. The rooms are beautiful and roomy. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The food in all the restaurants are tops, haven't had a bad meal yet, and we've been visiting Peppermill 12 years now. We have many friends that visit Peppermill and they all say they feel safe gambling late into the nite. I know it's they only place we will stay.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.text: Highly recommend the Peppermill to anyone. The Tuscany Tower is the equivalent of a $300 room in another US city. In Europe this room would be $700 US a night minimum! All the bathrooms have an oversized Jacuzzi tub and enough room to have a party in. If you need to keep your budget in line, the Peppermill Tower is a great value also and the rooms are very comfortable. Also the Peppermill Tower rooms have recently been updated and no matter which tower you choose they are all relaxing. DO NOT CHOOSE THE OLD MOTOR INN SECTION! You will hate these rooms.They are a long walk to get to and your view could be of the trash in which the front desk will fail to mention this fact.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For restaurants, try Biscotti's or the coffee shop, both very good. The buffet is good but not the best I have ever been to. For bars, the Fireside Lounge is the absolute best in the evening. Period!
reviews.title: First time staying at the Peppermill in Reno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE BAD AT THE HOTEL: The front desk is a hit or miss on service. Some times you get someone who is trained properly and sometimes not. The problem is you are in Reno!!! and they don't understand how good service actually works. The good news is they have been working on it but it has taken years and years to fix the key missing link, the front desk bad service and they still have a long way to go to. Otherwise, love the Peppermill.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Short weekend stay in Reno. Peppermill at first impression the sign on the exterior appears to be a bit outdated. Checkin/registration could have gone a tad bit smoother because our room wasn't ready at 3:00pm as originally planned. The suite that we got faced the pool, great view and jacuzzi tub in the room was a nice touch. Shower had a built in steamer and the bathroom was clean. So far this has been a great experience...
reviews.title: The best Reno has to offer

reviews.text: We were in town due to a death in the family. Several of us stayed at the Peppermill and the front desk went above and beyond to be helpful. A big thank you to Karen and Cheryl and the others that helped us out.
reviews.title: Excellent service and stay during difficult time
So relaxing
reviews.text: We stayed in a double king in the Tuscan tower and I really do not remember staying in a room that beautiful in years. It was a little overdone but in a beautiful way - the bathroom...marble, jacuzzi tub, double shower, private loo, TV, vanity stand. Comfortable beds with plenty of pillows. Very spacious and nice.

We are not used to the new minibar food tray that will charge you if you pick anything up for more than 45 seconds so we avoided that part of our room. And my big criticism ? They need a towel hook by the shower.
reviews.title: Worst customer survive, all but one young man.

reviews.text: The casino area, spa, outdoor pool facilities and restaurants all looked amazing. Aside from some quick breakfasts in the Cafe Milano, coffee at Biscottis and a few slots, we did not get to indulge this trip. I would love to come back on a happier occasion and enjoy all the resort has to offer.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been here several times & really never have a bad visit. We had some minor issues at check in this time, but the day manager, Mel, took excellent care of us. We always stay in the Tuscany Tower because its just gorgeous & so nice...large rooms with huge bathrooms (double sinks & dual shower heads too!). We love the spa, Bimini's steakhouse & Oceano for sushi. Really....the only reason we usually leave the hotel is for breakfast at Stone House Cafe (see my review on that gem!) and to stock up on cigars at Fumare.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

description: Travel Weekly’s 2009 Silver Magellan Award Winner and Named Top Industry Supplier by Conventions.net. Located on Reno’s main thoroughfare between a revitalized downtown and the city’s south end which features upscale shopping and dining, the Peppermill offers 1635 guest rooms, including 600 lavishly appointed suites, 10 award-winning restaurants, 17 bars and lounges, two resort pools, three-story Spa Toscana, and free live entertainment or dancing until the wee hours in Reno’s hottest nightspot, EDGE.
